title: 3-Section Inference Scoring
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response

The primary goal of this question were to assess a studentâ€™s ability to (1) construct and interpret a confidence interval for the slope of a regression line; and (2) determine if the confidence interval contradicts or supports a prior belief/claim.

Scoring

This question is scored in three sections. Section 1 consists of computing the 95% confidence interval for the slope of the true regression line in part (a). Section 2 consists of the interpretation of the confidence interval in part (a). Section 3 consists of the response to part (b). Sections 1, 2, and 3 are each scored as essentially correct (E), partially correct (P), or incorrect (I).
descriptions:
All three sections incorrect

OR

One section partially correct and two sections incorrect

One section essentially correct and two sections incorrect

OR

Two sections partially correct and one section incorrect

Two sections essentially correct and one section incorrect

OR

One section essentially correct and two sections partially correct

OR

One section essentially correct, one section partially correct, and one section incorrect

OR

All three sections partially correct
Two sections essentially correct and one section partially correct
